com.lonepulse.robozombie.proxy
Class Zombie

java.lang.Object
  com.lonepulse.robozombie.proxy.Zombie

public final class Zombie
extends Object

An animated corpse which spreads the Endpoint infection via a Bite. Used for injecting concrete implementations of endpoint interface definitions. Place an @Bite annotation on all instance properties which are endpoints and invoke infect(Object, Object...).

To avoid unnecessary traversal up an inheritance hierarchy, specify the prefixes of the packages to search for injection targets using infect(String, Object, Object...) and infect(List, Object, Object...).

Since:
1.1.0

Version:
1.4.0

Author:
Lahiru Sahan Jayasinghe

Method Detail

infect

public static void infect(Object victim,
                          Object... moreVictims)

Accepts an object and scans it for Bite annotations. If found, a thread-safe proxy for the endpoint interface will be injected.

Injection targets will be searched up an inheritance hierarchy until a type is found which is in a package whose name starts with "android.", "java.", "javax." or "junit.".


Usage:

  • Property Injection
     @Bite
 private GitHubEndpoint gitHubEndpoint;
 {
     Zombie.infect(this);
 }
  • Setter Injection
     @Bite
 private GitHubEndpoint gitHubEndpoint;
 {
     Zombie.infect(this);
 }
 
 
 public void setGitHubEndpoint(GitHubEndpoint gitHubEndpoint) {
 
     this.gitHubEndpoint = gitHubEndpoint;
 }

Parameters:
victim - an object with endpoint references marked to be bitten and infected

moreVictims - more unsuspecting objects with endpoint references to be infected

Throws:
NullPointerException - if the object supplied for endpoint injection is null

Since:
1.3.0

infect

public static void infect(String packagePrefix,
                          Object victim,
                          Object... moreVictims)

Accepts an object and scans it for Bite annotations. If found, a thread-safe proxy for the endpoint interface will be injected.

Injection targets will be searched up an inheritance hierarchy until a type is found which is not in a package whose name starts with the given package prefix.


Usage:

  • Property Injection
     @Bite
 private GitHubEndpoint gitHubEndpoint;
 {
     Zombie.infect("com.example", this);
 }
  • Setter Injection
     @Bite
 private GitHubEndpoint gitHubEndpoint;
 {
     Zombie.infect("com.example", this);
 }
 
 
 public void setGitHubEndpoint(GitHubEndpoint gitHubEndpoint) {
 
     this.gitHubEndpoint = gitHubEndpoint;
 }

Parameters:
packagePrefix - the prefix of the package to restrict hierarchical lookup of injection targets; if null or "", infect(Object, Object...) will be used

victim - an object with endpoint references marked to be bitten and infected

moreVictims - more unsuspecting objects with endpoint references to be infected

Throws:
NullPointerException - if the object supplied for endpoint injection is null

Since:
1.3.0

infect

public static void infect(List<String> packagePrefixes,
                          Object victim,
                          Object... moreVictims)

Accepts an object and scans it for Bite annotations. If found, a thread-safe proxy for the endpoint interface will be injected.

Injection targets will be searched up an inheritance hierarchy until a type is found which is not in a package whose name starts with the given package prefixes.


Usage:

  • Property Injection
     @Bite
 private GitHubEndpoint gitHubEndpoint;
 {
     Zombie.infect(Arrays.asList("com.example.service", "com.example.manager"), this);
 }
  • Setter Injection
     @Bite
 private GitHubEndpoint gitHubEndpoint;
 {
     Zombie.infect(Arrays.asList("com.example.service", "com.example.manager"), this);
 }
 
 
 public void setGitHubEndpoint(GitHubEndpoint gitHubEndpoint) {
 
     this.gitHubEndpoint = gitHubEndpoint;
 }

Parameters:
packagePrefixes - the prefixes of packages to restrict hierarchical lookup of injection targets; if null or empty, infect(Object, Object...) will be used

victim - an object with endpoint references marked to be bitten and infected

moreVictims - more unsuspecting objects with endpoint references to be infected

Throws:
NullPointerException - if the object supplied for endpoint injection is null

Since:
1.3.0
